CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 3, 1962, pg. 3, reads: "LANDMARK RAZED - This landmark, at the corner of Wylie Ave. and Chauncey St., has been torn down...marking the end of a fabulous era." Article begins: "From a large house with a big yard ...to Ward Calloway's Hotel...to a famous night-club spot...to Dearling's Restaurant...to "Cap" Stewart and "Pops" Harris' Cafe...to Mutt's Hut...and out.  This is the colorful background surrounding the building at Wylie Ave. and Chauncey St., which has been razed, thus terminating another landmark in Pittsburgh's once sophisticated "Upper Hill."
TitMainTitle: Demolition of buildings, including Allen's Hotel (formerly Harris Hotel and Grill), with men on roof, truck parked in front, and barricade of doors, Wylie Avenue at Chauncey Street, Hill District
